page.title: 01The area around Bawood
page.content: The area in this block is almost totally owned by the Earl of Shelbourn, and is mostly farmed by tenant farmers. Estate workers repair and maintain estate property, and gamekeepers organize shoots for foreign clients. Local people clean the house at Bawood and are employed as guides etc. The house is open to the public for six months each year. In block number four a large factory which employed over 2000 people in the pig industry (Harris' Pork Pies) has just been demolished. In block number nine there is a small village of thatched roof houses now privately owned. In block four there is a landing pad for helicopter inspections of an oil pipeline.
